meanings.definition: A short, stiff hair or fiber.
meanings.sent1: The brush had a single bristle sticking out.
meanings.sent2: The porcupine's quills are actually bristles.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended his hair was made of bristles.
meanings.sent4: The pine tree's needles looked like bristles on a giant brush.
meanings.sent5: The old broom had lost most of its bristles over time.

meanings.sent1: She tends to bristle whenever someone criticizes her work.
meanings.sent2: The cat will bristle if you try to pet it when it's not in the mood.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but bristle at the rude comment, even though he tried to stay calm.
meanings.sent4: The soldier's words made the general bristle with anger.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern tone made the students bristle with apprehension.

meanings.definition: To be covered or filled with something.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor would bristle with fallen leaves in autumn.
meanings.sent2: Her face would bristle with excitement as she talked about her upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The bakery counter would bristle with colorful cupcakes, tempting every customer.
meanings.sent4: The night sky would bristle with stars, creating a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The garden would bristle with flowers of all shapes and colors in the spring.
